s: ^"Hey boss, I was hoping I could talk to you about my injury..."

c-0: ^"Of course Sam, come on in... What's on your mind?"

s: ^"I'm ready to come back boss, I want to play in the final."
^"Doc doesn't think I'm ready to be back yet... but I want you to put me in the squad for the final."

c-0: ^"That's not what I heard... Doc says you're not fully healed yet."

s: ^"He worries too much... I got through training fine yesterday, ask the coaches."
^"That's not his call, I know my body better than anyone and I'm ready."

c-0: ^"When he worries, I worry. This is the biggest game this club has faced for years and I don't want to start a player who won't be able to give 100%"

s: ^"What Rugby player ever feels 100%? I've been playing with injuries since I was 23, this is no different."
^"I get it boss but a minor concussion won't stop me from giving you my best."

c-0: ^"It's very different, concussions have to be taken seriously Sam. You've done great things for this team since you singed for us, but I don't know whether beinging you back so soon is what's best."

s: ^"I'm telling you, I can play through it. The moment you think you see my performance drop, you can take me off."

c-0: ^"Fine. I'll give you the start, but the first second you start to struggle, we bring you off."

s: ^"Absolutely, the last thing I want to do is hold the team back. Thanks for backing me boss."

c-0: ^"You've earnt that much from me Sam, don't let me down."

c-1: ^"I'm not doubting your work ethic Sam, but every concussion is serious. Are you really sure you can play 80 minutes?"

s: ^"I wouldn't risk it if I wasn't sure, there's no way I could do that to the team. I can do this for them, I'm sure of it."

c-0: ^"Alright Sam, I know the team will feel better having you out there to lead them. Just remember them when you're out there. Any sign of symptoms I want you to let us know."

s: ^"Of course Gaffer, I swear you'll only get my best. If I'm giving any less that that, I'll take myself off."

c-0: ^"I know you will. Report to the training pitch, and make sure you see the Doc again to pass the protocols."

c-1: ^"You're right, it's not his call. It's mine. And I trust the word of the Doc, over a player desperate to prove themselves."

s: ^"I'm not trying to prove anything, my career speaks for itself. That team can't win this without me!"
^"I'm don't mean to question the Doc, but I know myself and I can play. I want to be out there for the team."

c-0: ^"I strongly disagree with that Sam... but it will make it harder for us. Fine, you can play, but your hitting the bench at the first sign of any concussion symptoms."

s: ^"You're making the right decision boss. I've got this."

c-0: ^"You'd better Sam... I've got meetings to attend. We'll talk again soon."

c-1: ^"I appreciate that Sam, and I know the team do too. Listen, if you're sure, I'll start you. But the team comes first, and if you're slowing them down, I won't hesitate to pull you out."

s: ^"Absolutely, the last thing I want to do is hold the team back. Thanks for backing me boss."

c-0: ^"No problem Sam, I'll have a word with the Doc. Don't let me down."
